Suspension of registration
	Suspension of registration
		After section 128 of the [Road Traffic Act 1988 (c.52)](/id/ukpga/1988/52?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (as substitutedby Schedule 6 to the [Road Safety Act 2006 (c.49)](/id/ukpga/2006/49?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")) (terminationof registration by Registrar) insert—
		“128ZASuspension of registration by Registrar
			The Registrar may suspend a person’s registration in respect of anydescription of driving instruction if the Registrar—
				has given, or is about to give, the person notice under section 127(5) or128(4) in relation to the person’s registration in respect of that descriptionof driving instruction,
				is considering whether to refuse the application for an extension of theperson’s registration or (as the case may be) whether to terminate theperson’s registration, or has decided so to refuse or terminate but thedecision is not yet in effect, and
				believes that the person would pose a significant threat to the safety ofmembers of the public if the person’s registration were not suspended.
			The Registrar must, on deciding to suspend a person’s registration inrespect of any description of driving instruction, give written notice of thedecision to the person.
			The decision to suspend takes effect on the giving of the notice.
			No notice may be given under subsection (2) before the notice under section127(5) or (as the case may be) 128(4) is given but the subsection (2) noticemay be included in the section 127(5) or 128(4) notice if the section 127(5)or 128(4) notice is still to be given when the decision to suspend is made.
			A suspension under this section is terminated if—
				the Registrar decides not to refuse the application for an extension of theperson’s registration or (as the case may be) decides not to terminate theperson’s registration,
				the Registrar decides to refuse the application for an extension of theperson’s registration or (as the case may be) to terminate the person’sregistration but the decision has not taken effect and an appeal against thedecision is successfully concluded,
				the Registrar has not decided whether to refuse the application for anextension of the person’s registration or (as the case may be) whether toterminate the person’s registration and the period of 75 days beginning withthe giving of the section 127(5) or 128(4) notice has ended,
				the person’s registration is terminated (whether under section 128 orotherwise), or
				the Registrar decides to terminate the suspension.
			The Registrar must give written notice to a person of the fact that theperson’s suspension is terminated as mentioned in subsection (5)(a) to (c) or(e).
			For the purposes of this Part of this Act, the fact that a person’sregistration is suspended does not prevent the person from being “registered”;and “registration” is to be construed accordingly.”
			In section 123(1)(a) and (b) of the [Road Traffic Act 1988 (c.52)](/id/ukpga/1988/52?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (as substitutedby Schedule 6 to the Act of 2006) (prohibition on giving paid drivinginstruction or carrying on business in the provision of paid drivinginstruction when unregistered) after “of driving instruction” insert “and theregistration is not suspended”.
			In section 123A(3) of the [Road Traffic Act1988](/id/ukpga/1988/52?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (assubstituted by Schedule 6 to the Act of 2006) (defence to offence ofcontravening the prohibition) after “question” insert “or (as the case may be)that the registration was at that time suspended”.
			In section 142 of the [Road Traffic Act 1988](/id/ukpga/1988/52?view=plain"Go to item of legislation") (as substituted by Schedule 6 to the Act of 2006)(index to Part 5), in the entry in the table for “Registered andregistration”, for “Section 123(7)” substitute “Sections 123(7) and 128ZA(7)”.
			In subsection (1) of section 18 of the [Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988 (c.53)](/id/ukpga/1988/53?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (as it haseffect with the substitution of paragraphs (a) to (d) of that subsection bySchedule 6 to the Act of 2006) (evidence by certificate as to registrationetc. of driving instructors etc.), after paragraph (b) and before the word“or” at the end of the paragraph, insert—
				a person’s registration was, or was not, suspended,”.
	Compensation in respect of suspension
		After section 128ZA of the [Road Traffic Act 1988 (c.52)](/id/ukpga/1988/52?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (as inserted orto be inserted by section 1(1) above) insert—
		“128ZBCompensation in respect of suspension
			The Secretary of State must by regulations make a scheme for the making ofpayments by the Secretary of State to persons in respect of one or more of thefollowing—
				income losses incurred by them as a result of their registrations beingsuspended by virtue of section 128ZA,
				non-income losses so incurred, and
				any other matters which relate to such a suspension and are provided for inthe scheme.
			No payments may be made under a scheme in respect of a person’s suspensionunless—
				the suspension is terminated because the Registrar decides not to refusethe application for an extension of the person’s registration or (as the casemay be) decides not to terminate the person’s registration,
				an appeal is successfully concluded against the decision of the Registrarto refuse the application for an extension of the person’s registration or (asthe case may be) to terminate the person’s registration (whether or not theRegistrar’s decision has taken effect), or
				any other circumstances provided for in the scheme apply.
			Where the decision of the Registrar to refuse the application for anextension of the person’s registration or (as the case may be) to terminatethe person’s registration has taken effect before an appeal against it issuccessfully concluded, any payments under a scheme may relate only to thesuspension.
			A scheme may, in particular, specify—
				the description or descriptions of income losses, or
				the description or descriptions of non-income losses,
					in respect of which payments are to be made but need not provide for themaking of payments in respect of all income losses or all non-income losses orfor the making of payments which correspond to the full amount of any incomelosses or non-income losses.
			A scheme may also, in particular—
				specify the basis or bases of valuation for determining losses or theperson who is to decide their valuation,
				specify the amounts of payments to be made or the basis or bases on whichsuch amounts are to be calculated,
				provide for the procedure to be followed (including when claims may be madeand the provision of information) in respect of claims under the scheme andfor the determination of such claims.
			A person who is aggrieved by a decision of the Secretary of State as to theperson’s entitlement to payments under a scheme or the amounts of any suchpayments may appeal to the First-tier Tribunal.
			On an appeal, the First-tier Tribunal may make such order as it considersappropriate.
			If the Tribunal considers that any evidence adduced on an appeal had notbeen adduced to the Secretary of State before the making of the decision towhich the appeal relates, the Tribunal may (instead of making an order undersubsection (7)) remit the matter to the Secretary of State for the Secretaryof State to reconsider the decision.
			In this section—
				  * “income losses” means losses of income, and
				  * “non-income losses” means losses other than income losses.”
Exemptions from registration
	Exemptions from prohibitions concerning registration
		After section 124(2) of the [Road Traffic Act 1988 (c.52)](/id/ukpga/1988/52?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (as substitutedby Schedule 6 to the [Road Safety Act 2006 (c.49)](/id/ukpga/2006/49?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")) (exemptionfrom prohibitions imposed by section 123) insert—
		Circumstances prescribed by virtue of this section may, in particular,consist of, or include, the exercise (whether in individual cases orotherwise) of a discretion by the Registrar or another person.
		Regulations prescribing circumstances of the kind mentioned in subsection(3) may, in particular, make provision about—
			the procedure to be followed in relation to any decision resulting from theexercise of the discretion,
			the review or revocation of such a decision,
			an appeal against such a decision,
			the time when such a decision has effect,
			the suspension of an exemption in connection with the making of such adecision (including provision corresponding to that made by, or capable ofbeing made under, section 128ZB).
		Regulations made by virtue of this section may, in particular, makeprovision for the payment of fees.”
Transitory amendments to existing regime
	Transitory amendments to existing regime
		Schedule 1 (which contains amendments to Part 5 of the [Road Traffic Act1988](/id/ukpga/1988/52?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") as it haseffect without the amendments and repeals made by the [Road Safety Act2006](/id/ukpga/2006/49?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")) has effect.
		The enactments listed in Schedule 2 are repealed to the extent specified.
Supplementary and final provisions
	Consequential provision
		The Secretary of State may by order make such supplementary, incidental orconsequential provision as the Secretary of State considers appropriate forthe purposes of this Act or in consequence of this Act.
		The power to make an order under this section—
			is exercisable by statutory instrument,
			includes power to make transitional, transitory or saving provision,
			may, in particular, be exercised by amending, repealing, revoking orotherwise modifying any provision made by or under an enactment (including anyAct passed in the same Session as this Act).
		In subsection (2)(c) “enactment” includes an Act of the ScottishParliament.
		Subject to subsection (5), an instrument containing an order under thissection may not be made unless a draft of the instrument has been laid before,and approved by a resolution of, each House of Parliament.
		An instrument containing an order under this section which does not amendor repeal a provision of a public general Act or an Act of the ScottishParliament is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of eitherHouse of Parliament.
	Transitional, transitory and saving provision
		The Secretary of State may by order made by statutory instrument make suchtransitional, transitory or saving provision as the Secretary of Stateconsiders appropriate in connection with the coming into force of anyprovision of this Act.
		An order under subsection (1) may, in particular, take account of anyamendment or repeal made, or to be made, by Schedule 6 to the Road Safety Act[2006 (c. 49)](/id/ukpga/2006/49?view=plain "Go to item of legislation").
	Short title, commencement and extent
		This Act may be cited as the Driving Instruction (Suspension and ExemptionPowers) Act 2009.
		Sections 5 and 6 and this section come into force on the day on which thisAct is passed.
		Sections 1 to 4 and Schedules 1 and 2 come into force on such day as theSecretary of State may by order made by statutory instrument appoint; anddifferent days may be appointed for different purposes.
		This Act extends only to England and Wales and Scotland.
